response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("Age", "low", "18 years old is generally considered a lower risk demographic"),
    ("Race/Ethnicity", "medium", "Statistical disparities exist, warranting consideration"),
    ("Prior Arrests", "high", "Four prior arrests indicate a pattern of potential criminal behavior"),
    ("Prior Convictions", "high", "Convictions suggest a history of legal transgressions"),
    ("Physical Characteristics", "low", "Height and weight are not predictive of recidivism"),
    ("Marital Status", "medium", "Lack of stable partnership can be a risk factor"),

    ("Education/Employment", "medium", "Enrollment in school is positive, but lack of employment raises concern"),
    ("Substance Abuse", "low", "No drug use in the past four years suggests reduced risk"),
    ("Mental Health", "medium", "Feelings of depression warrant attention and potential support"),
    ("Upbringing", "low", "Growing up in a large family in a rural area is not inherently predictive"),

  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 65
}

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is an 18-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 4 times and has been convicted. He is 5 feet 10 inches and weighs 155 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He is enrolled in school at the present moment. He has held no jobs during the year. He has not used any drugs in the past four years and some of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with both of his biological parents in a household of size 7, in a rural area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
